scope.title: Loading, empty and error states
scope.description: When loading data in an application, it is important to consider and design for loading, empty, and error states. These states will help set user expectations and prevent them from assuming that the interface is unresponsive.

pattern.content:
## Loading state The loading state provides feedback to users that data is being loaded. Loading states can reduce uncertainty for the user by explaining what is happening and preparing them for what is coming up next. [Skeleton components](/components/skeleton) can be used as visual placeholders for information that is still loading - e.g. cells inside of a table. ### Table loading state example Below is an example of a [Table](/components/table) in a loading state. ```jsx live ID NameEmail {Array.from(Array(5)).map((_, idx) => ( Loading Loading Loading ))}
``` ### Cards loading state example Below is an example of a list of [Cards](/components/card) in a loading state. ```jsx live {Array.from(Array(2).keys()).map((i) => ( Loading ))} ``` ## Error state The error state provides feedback to users that an error has occurred while loading the data. If applicable, use a [Button](/components-button) component to provide the user with an option to retrieve the data again. ### Page level error state Below is an example of an error that occured at the page level. ```jsx live Failed to load There was an error loading the data. Click retry to try again. ``` ### Component level error state Below is an example of an error that occured at the component level. ```jsx live Failed to load
There was an error loading the data. Click retry to try again. ``` ## Empty state The empty state is displayed when data has loaded succesfully, but there is nothing available to show to the user. This state could potentially be a result of either: - a user visting a service for the time and there being no data to display - a user applying settings or filters which ends up in no results being found Depending on what caused the empty state, provide clear messaging and a helpful action to get rid of the empty state via a [Button](/components/button) component. ### Page level empty state examples Below is an example of two different empty states at the page level. ```jsx live Add an establishment You havenâ€™t added any establishments yet. ``` ```jsx live No results found Try adjusting your filter options. ``` ### Component level empty state example Below is an example of an empty state at the component level. ```jsx live No results found
Try adjusting your filter options. ```
